definitions.definition: resting on the surface of somebody/something and partly or completely covering them/it

examples.text: I put a blanket over the sleeping child.
He wore an overcoat over his suit.
She put her hand over her mouth to stop herself from screaming.

definitions.definition: in or to a position higher than but not touching somebody/something; above somebody/something

examples.text: They held a large umbrella over her.
The balcony juts out over the street.
There was a lamp hanging over the table.

definitions.definition: from one side of something to the other; across something

examples.text: a bridge over the river
They ran over the grass.
They had a wonderful view over the park.

definitions.definition: so as to cross something and be on the other side

examples.text: She climbed over the wall.

definitions.definition: falling from or down from a place

examples.text: The car had toppled over the cliff.
He didn't dare look over the edge.

definitions.definition: on the far or opposite side of something

examples.text: He lives **over the road**.

definitions.definition: in or on all or most parts of something

examples.text: Snow is falling all over the country.
They've travelled all over the world.
There were papers lying around **all over the place**.

definitions.definition: more than a particular time, amount, cost, etc.

examples.text: over 3 million copies sold
She stayed in Lagos for over a month.
He's over sixty.

definitions.definition: used to show that somebody has control or authority

examples.text: She has only the director over her.
He ruled over a great empire.
She has editorial control over what is included.
We'll discuss it over lunch.
Over the next few days they got to know the town well.
She has not changed much over the years.
He built up the business over a period of ten years.
We're away over *(= until after)* the New Year.

definitions.definition: past a particular difficult stage or situation

examples.text: We're **over the worst** of the recession.
It took her ages to **get over** her illness.

definitions.definition: because of or relating to something; about something

examples.text: an argument over money
a disagreement over the best way to proceed

definitions.definition: using something; by means of something

examples.text: We heard it over the radio.
She wouldn't tell me over the phone.
I couldn't hear what he said over the noise of the traffic.
There are other factors over and above those we have discussed.
